item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Katherine Anne Porter
item.description: "The past is never where you think you left it." -- Katherine Anne Porter

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description:
"He put the knuckles of his fist to the table, leaned toward Niles and spoke quietly, cuttingly, in his rough, gravelly voice.
“Fucked her last night, man, and this morning. Five times. Five. It was like she hadn’t been touched in a decade. So fuckin’ sweet. Damn,” he taunted, his eyes locked on Niles. “You’ve had her, you gotta know, not enough money in the world’s worth that." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Sylvain Reynard
item.description: "Why not think that sometimes—just sometimes—you can overcome evil with silence? And let people hear their hatefulness in their own ears, without distraction. Maybe goodness is enough to expose evil for what it really is, sometimes." -- Sylvain Reynard

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description: "Not one fuckin’ thing gentlemanly about protecting what’s yours. Looks like you’re gonna lose it, you do everything you can to stop that from happening.” Max looked back to Niles. “And you didn’t do that. She was a week away from me, she walked into a room I was in holdin’ another man’s hand, I’d lose my fuckin’ mind. Not at her. Wonderin’ where I lost my way and I’d talk to her about how to find my way back." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description:
"Sick people are everywhere. Just watch Criminal Minds.”
“If that’s their subject matter, I’m thinkin’ I’ll avoid it." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description: "I’m tipsy, not blitzed.” Max twisted back and pulled into the road. “What chance I got you won’t pass out on the way home?” I waved my hand in front of me and declared, “Oh, I’ll be fine.” “Right,” Max muttered. “Can we listen to music?” I requested and Max turned on the music. Five minutes later I was dead to the world." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Mira Grant
item.description: "The difference between the truth and a lie is that both of them can hurt, but only one will take the time to heal you afterward." -- Mira Grant

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
item.description: "Then you shouldn't have thrown her away when she was your wife. Now she ain't. Now she's somethin' to me and I don't let men I don't like get close to her and I gotta tell you man, I do not like you." -- Kristen Ashley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Kristen Ashley
Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Julie Hockley
item.description: "Whoever said that love hurts was wrong. Love is excruciating, especially when you can feel it slipping through your fingers and there is nothing you can do about it. Like someone was playing tug-of-war with my limbs, ripping to shreds whatever was left behind. What it would feel like when love was lost...I wouldn't survive that" -- Julie Hockley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Jamie McGuire
item.description: "To douchebags!" he said, gesturing to Brad. "And to girls that break your heart," he bowed his head to me. His eyes lost focus. "And to the absolute fucking horror of losing your best friend because you were stupid enough to fall in love with her." -- Jamie McGuire

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "A friend is one to whom one may pour out the contents of one's heart, chaff and grain together, knowing that gentle hands will take and sift it, keep what is worth keeping, and with a breath of kindness, blow the rest away." -- George Eliot

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "But life is a battle: may we all be enabled to fight it well!" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "I no longer believed in the idea of soul mates, or love at first sight. But I was beginning to believe that a very few times in your life, if you were lucky, you might meet someone who was exactly right for you. Not because he was perfect, or because you were, but because your combined flaws were arranged in a way that allowed two separate beings to hinge together." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Teresa Mummert
item.description: "Never let the opinion of another affect your opinion of yourself." -- Teresa Mummert

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Teresa Mummert
item.description: "The moment you put someone on a pedestal they will look down upon you. The trick is respecting each other equally." -- Teresa Mummert

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by William Ernest Henley
item.description: "It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul." -- William Ernest Henley

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Tina Reber
item.description: "There's only one thing I need." I placed my hand on his heart. "The rest is just details." -- Tina Reber

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Melissa Brown
item.description: "I just wish the memories would fade. I wish the songs wouldn’t bring tears. And, I wish that his name would stop making my heart tremble. I want to forget. I need to forget. I deserve to forget. I have to forget." -- Melissa Brown

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat, or a prostitute." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Cristal (Professional Book Procrastinator) add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "Tonight’s December thirty-first, Something is about to burst. The clock is crouching, dark and small, Like a time bomb in the hall. Hark, it's midnight, children dear. Duck! Here comes another year!" -- Ogden Nash
